page.title: 17WEST HOUGHAM
page.content: There are two Houghams _ Church Hougham and West Hougham.They are separated from each other by about half a mile of fields. West Hougham is the larger and possesses a Post Office and General Stores and a recently re_opened public house,the Chequers,which is built in typical Kentish weatherboarding. Today few people who live in the village actually work in it,most have jobs in either Folkestone or Dover often connected with the Channel Ports. Each Spring Bank Holiday Monday, West Hougham holds a fete with stalls, games,refreshments and a display of country dancing by the children of Capel School. In 1665 Londoners brought the Plague to Hougham,900 people died and are buried in "The Graves" Abbott's Cliff.
